name: Find Maximum
description:
Valera has array a, consisting of n integers a0, a1, ..., an - 1, and function
f(x), taking an integer from 0 to 2^n - 1 as its single argument. Value f(x)
is calculated by formula , where value bit(i) equals one if the binary
representation of number x contains a 1 on the i-th position, and zero
otherwise. For example, if n = 4 and x = 11 (11 = 2^0 + 2^1 + 2^3), then f(x)
= a0 + a1 + a3. Help Valera find the maximum of function f(x) among all x, for
which an inequality holds: 0 ≤ x ≤ m. Input The first line contains integer n
(1 ≤ n ≤ 10^5) — the number of array elements. The next line contains n space-
separated integers a0, a1, ..., an - 1 (0 ≤ ai ≤ 10^4) — elements of array a.
The third line contains a sequence of digits zero and one without spaces
s0s1... sn - 1 — the binary representation of number m. Number m equals .
Output Print a single integer — the maximum value of function f(x) for all .
Examples Input 2 3 8 10 Output 3 Input 5 17 0 10 2 1 11010 Output 27 Note In
the first test case m = 2^0 = 1, f(0) = 0, f(1) = a0 = 3. In the second sample
m = 2^0 + 2^1 + 2^3 = 11, the maximum value of function equals f(5) = a0 + a2
= 17 + 10 = 27.
